intro: Phyllorkis nasuta, commonly known as the narrow-leafed daisy, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically has slender, hairy stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its flowers are yellow with a central disc, and it blooms from spring to autumn. Phyllorkis nasuta is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and woodland edges.
